# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    julia_blocks = search.(r"```julia\s*(\n.+?)\s*```", md)
    
    # Remove code fences and join multiple blocks with a newline
    stripped_julia_blocks = map(x -> strip(strip(x, "```julia\n"), "\n```"), julia_blocks)
    joined_code = join(stripped_julia_blocks, "\n")
    
    return joined_code
end

# Example usage (provided to demonstrate the function)
md = """```julia
println("hello world")
```"""
result = extract_julia_code(md)
println("Extracted Julia Code: $result") # Outputs "Extracted Julia Code: println(\"hello world\")"
```
